text: Wozzeck is a 1947 German drama film directed by Georg C. Klaren and starring Kurt Meisel, Max Eckard, and Helga Zülch. It is based upon the play, "Woyzeck," by Georg Büchner. The film's sets were designed by Bruno Monden and Hermann Warm. It was shot at Babelsberg and the Althoff Studios in Potsdam. ==Plot== Everything in town appears calm, placid, lovely. But Woyzeck, a rifleman assigned as an orderly, hears voices—the times are out of joint, at least in his cosmos. To his captain, Woyzeck is a comic marvel: ignorant but courageous and full of energy. ==Main cast== ==See also== * Woyzeck (1979 film) * Woyzeck (1994 film) == References == ==Bibliography== * == External links == * Category:1947 films Category:German-language films Category:East German films Category:Films directed by Georg C. title: Wozzeck (film)
